refsect1.title: Object Hierarchy
refsect1.screen: GEnum ├── GDataStreamByteOrder ╰── GDataStreamNewlineType GObject ╰── GInputStream ╰── GFilterInputStream ╰── GBufferedInputStream ╰── GDataInputStream

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Data input stream implements GInputStream and includes functions for reading structured data directly from a binary input stream.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new data input stream for the base_stream .

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order ()
refsect2.para: This function sets the byte order for the given stream . All subsequent reads from the stream will be read in the given order .

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order ()
refsect2.para: Gets the byte order for the data input stream.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_set_newline_type ()
refsect2.para: Sets the newline type for the stream .

Note that using G_DATA_STREAM_NEWLINE_TYPE_ANY is slightly unsafe. If a read chunk ends in "CR" we must read an additional byte to know if this is "CR" or "CR LF", and this might block if there is no more data available.

entry.para: the type of new line return as GDataStreamNewlineType.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_get_newline_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current newline type for the stream .

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_byte ()
refsect2.para: Reads an unsigned 8-bit/1-byte value from stream .

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: an unsigned 8-bit/1-byte value read from the stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_int16 ()
refsect2.para: Reads a 16-bit/2-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order() and g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order().

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a signed 16-bit/2-byte value read from stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_uint16 ()
refsect2.para: Reads an unsigned 16-bit/2-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order() and g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order().

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: an unsigned 16-bit/2-byte value read from the stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_int32 ()
refsect2.para: Reads a signed 32-bit/4-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order() and g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order().

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a signed 32-bit/4-byte value read from the stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: Reads an unsigned 32-bit/4-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order() and g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order().

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: an unsigned 32-bit/4-byte value read from the stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_int64 ()
refsect2.para: Reads a 64-bit/8-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order() and g_data_input_stream_set_byte_order().

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a signed 64-bit/8-byte value read from stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: Reads an unsigned 64-bit/8-byte value from stream .
In order to get the correct byte order for this read operation, see g_data_input_stream_get_byte_order().

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: an unsigned 64-bit/8-byte read from stream or 0 if an error occurred.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_line ()
refsect2.para: Reads a line from the data input stream. Note that no encoding checks or conversion is performed; the input is not guaranteed to be UTF-8, and may in fact have embedded NUL characters.

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: a gsize to get the length of the data read in.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NUL terminated byte array with the line that was read in (without the newlines). Set length to a gsize to get the length of the read line. On an error, it will return NULL and error will be set. If there's no content to read, it will still return NULL, but error won't be set.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_line_utf8 ()
refsect2.para: Reads a UTF-8 encoded line from the data input stream.

If cancellable is not NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.

entry.para: a gsize to get the length of the data read in.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NUL terminated UTF-8 string with the line that was read in (without the newlines). Set length to a gsize to get the length of the read line. On an error, it will return NULL and error will be set. For UTF-8 conversion errors, the set error domain is G_CONVERT_ERROR. If there's no content to read, it will still return NULL, but error won't be set.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_line_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_data_input_stream_read_line_async (GDataInputStream *stream, gint io_priority, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: The asynchronous version of g_data_input_stream_read_line(). It is an error to have two outstanding calls to this function.
When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_data_input_stream_read_line_finish() to get the result of the operation.

entry.para: the I/O priority of the request
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
callback to call when the request is satisfied.
the data to pass to callback function.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_line_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous call started by g_data_input_stream_read_line_async(). Note the warning about string encoding in g_data_input_stream_read_line() applies here as well.

entry.para: the GAsyncResult that was provided to the callback.
a gsize to get the length of the data read in.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NUL-terminated byte array with the line that was read in (without the newlines). Set length to a gsize to get the length of the read line. On an error, it will return NULL and error will be set. If there's no content to read, it will still return NULL, but error won't be set.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_line_finish_utf8 ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous call started by g_data_input_stream_read_line_async().

entry.para: the GAsyncResult that was provided to the callback.
a gsize to get the length of the data read in.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string with the line that was read in (without the newlines). Set length to a gsize to get the length of the read line. On an error, it will return NULL and error will be set. For UTF-8 conversion errors, the set error domain is G_CONVERT_ERROR. If there's no content to read, it will still return NULL, but error won't be set.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.30

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_upto ()
refsect2.programlisting: char * g_data_input_stream_read_upto (GDataInputStream *stream, const gchar *stop_chars, gssize stop_chars_len, gsize *length, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Reads a string from the data input stream, up to the first occurrence of any of the stop characters.

In contrast to g_data_input_stream_read_until(), this function does not consume the stop character. You have to use g_data_input_stream_read_byte() to get it before calling g_data_input_stream_read_upto() again.
Note that stop_chars may contain '\0' if stop_chars_len is specified.
The returned string will always be nul-terminated on success.

entry.para: length of stop_chars . May be -1 if stop_chars is nul-terminated
a gsize to get the length of the data read in.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string with the data that was read before encountering any of the stop characters. Set length to a gsize to get the length of the string. This function will return NULL on an error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async (GDataInputStream *stream, const gchar *stop_chars, gssize stop_chars_len, gint io_priority, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: The asynchronous version of g_data_input_stream_read_upto(). It is an error to have two outstanding calls to this function.

In contrast to g_data_input_stream_read_until(), this function does not consume the stop character. You have to use g_data_input_stream_read_byte() to get it before calling g_data_input_stream_read_upto() again.
Note that stop_chars may contain '\0' if stop_chars_len is specified.
When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_data_input_stream_read_upto_finish() to get the result of the operation.

entry.para: length of stop_chars . May be -1 if stop_chars is nul-terminated
the I/O priority of the request
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
callback to call when the request is satisfied.
the data to pass to callback function.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_upto_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous call started by g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async().
Note that this function does not consume the stop character. You have to use g_data_input_stream_read_byte() to get it before calling g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async() again.
The returned string will always be nul-terminated on success.

entry.para: the GAsyncResult that was provided to the callback
a gsize to get the length of the data read in.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string with the data that was read before encountering any of the stop characters. Set length to a gsize to get the length of the string. This function will return NULL on an error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.24

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_until ()

warning.para: g_data_input_stream_read_until has been deprecated since version 2.56 and should not be used in newly-written code.
Use g_data_input_stream_read_upto() instead, which has more consistent behaviour regarding the stop character.

refsect2.para: Reads a string from the data input stream, up to the first occurrence of any of the stop characters.
Note that, in contrast to g_data_input_stream_read_until_async(), this function consumes the stop character that it finds.

Don't use this function in new code. Its functionality is inconsistent with g_data_input_stream_read_until_async(). Both functions will be marked as deprecated in a future release. Use g_data_input_stream_read_upto() instead, but note that that function does not consume the stop character.

entry.para: a gsize to get the length of the data read in.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string with the data that was read before encountering any of the stop characters. Set length to a gsize to get the length of the string. This function will return NULL on an error.

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_until_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_data_input_stream_read_until_async (GDataInputStream *stream, const gchar *stop_chars, gint io_priority, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);

warning.para: g_data_input_stream_read_until_async has been deprecated since version 2.56 and should not be used in newly-written code.
Use g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async() instead, which has more consistent behaviour regarding the stop character.

refsect2.para: The asynchronous version of g_data_input_stream_read_until(). It is an error to have two outstanding calls to this function.
Note that, in contrast to g_data_input_stream_read_until(), this function does not consume the stop character that it finds. You must read it for yourself.
When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call g_data_input_stream_read_until_finish() to get the result of the operation.

Don't use this function in new code. Its functionality is inconsistent with g_data_input_stream_read_until(). Both functions will be marked as deprecated in a future release. Use g_data_input_stream_read_upto_async() instead.

entry.para: the I/O priority of the request
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
callback to call when the request is satisfied.
the data to pass to callback function.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: g_data_input_stream_read_until_finish ()

warning.para: g_data_input_stream_read_until_finish has been deprecated since version 2.56 and should not be used in newly-written code.
Use g_data_input_stream_read_upto_finish() instead, which has more consistent behaviour regarding the stop character.

refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous call started by g_data_input_stream_read_until_async().

entry.para: the GAsyncResult that was provided to the callback.
a gsize to get the length of the data read in.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string with the data that was read before encountering any of the stop characters. Set length to a gsize to get the length of the string. This function will return NULL on an error.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.20

refsect2.title: GDataInputStream
refsect2.para: An implementation of GBufferedInputStream that allows for high-level data manipulation of arbitrary data (including binary operations).

refsect2.title: enum GDataStreamByteOrder
refsect2.para: GDataStreamByteOrder is used to ensure proper endianness of streaming data sources across various machine architectures.

entry.para: Selects endianness based on host machine's architecture.

refsect2.title: enum GDataStreamNewlineType
refsect2.para: GDataStreamNewlineType is used when checking for or setting the line endings for a given file.

entry.para: Selects "LF" line endings, common on most modern UNIX platforms.
Selects "CR, LF" line ending, common on Microsoft Windows.
Automatically try to handle any line ending type.

refsect2.title: The byte-order property
refsect2.para: The byte order.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: G_DATA_STREAM_BYTE_ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN

refsect2.title: The newline-type property
refsect2.para: The accepted types of line ending.
Flags: Read / Write
Default value: G_DATA_STREAM_NEWLINE_TYPE_LF
